definition: fair/equitable
justice/fairness/public highway

public/collectively owned/common/international (e.g. high seas, metric system, calendar)/make public/fair/just/Duke, highest of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/honorable (gentlemen)/father-in-law/male (animal)

road/path/CL:條|条[tiao2],股[gu3]/principle/truth/morality/reason/skill/method/Dao (of Daoism)/to say/to speak/to talk/classifier for long thin things (rivers, cracks etc), barriers (walls, doors etc), questions (in an exam etc), commands, courses in a meal, steps in a process/(old) circuit (administrative division)

sentences.english: Our company always values its customers’ satisfaction in taking care of every quality requirement and providing best speeding services in reasonable prices.
sentences.chinese: 本公司顾客至上，质量超卓，效率快捷，取价公道。

sentences.english: He does not want to go after the oil companies.
sentences.chinese: 他不想向石油公司讨回公道。

sentences.english: I must admit that he is a pretty talented person.
sentences.chinese: 不过说句公道话，我得承认他是个很有才华的人。

sentences.english: For example, Capricorns like to eat in popular places with good prices .
sentences.chinese: 比如说，他们喜欢选择在价格公道的大众餐厅用餐。

sentences.english: Your unit price seems fair enough, but we're hoping for a higher discount rate.
sentences.chinese: 单价仿佛公道，但我们希看赐与更高的折扣率。

sentences.english: Oh, well let me defend this old word bench.
sentences.chinese: 哦，还是让我来替这个单词说两句公道话吧。

sentences.english: The Lord restores justice and secures the rights of the oppressed.
sentences.chinese: 上主常行正义的工作，为受压迫者主持公道。

sentences.english: Thirdly, we must be fair and reasonable.
sentences.chinese: 第三，待人处事都要公道。

sentences.english: They are going to get back on justice.
Then he undertaked the responsibility to return justice to the student.
sentences.chinese: 然后他承担了帮大学生讨回公道的任务。

sentences.english: But to give the devil his due, I must admit that he is a pretty talented person.
sentences.chinese: 不过说句公道话，我得承认他是个很有才华的人。

sentences.english: She hopes health care reform will allow her to buy reasonably priced health insurance.
sentences.chinese: 她希望医改能让她买到价格公道的医疗保险。

sentences.english: To be fair, by no means all of these were due to government policies.
sentences.chinese: 但说句公道话，并不全是由于政府政策所造成的。

sentences.english: His ultimate goal was to bring fair back to the undergraduate.
sentences.chinese: 他的最终目标是为大学生讨回公道。

sentences.english: There traveling businessmen found accommodation at moderate terms.
sentences.chinese: 旅游的商人感到那儿的膳宿费是公道的。

sentences.english: Ought he not to treat her generously, fairly, honourably ?
sentences.chinese: 他不应该慷慨，公道而诚实地对待她吗？

definition: to ask for sth back/to recover
just/fair/equitable
arbitration (law)
conducting business impartially (idiom); to act justly
to right wrongs/to redress an injustice
conscience
to appeal for justice/to demand redress for a grievance
to pay with one's life
to plea for leniency/to ask for a favor
pure/innocent
to speak out for justice (idiom); to take a stand on a matter of principle
to receive unjust treatment/injustice
lit. right and wrong, crooked and straight (idiom); fig. merits and demerits/pros and cons
to intercede/to plead for sb else
guilty and deserves to be punished (idiom); entirely appropriate chastisement/the punishment fits the crime
death cannot wipe out the crimes (idiom); dreadful crimes that rankled even after the perpetrator is dead
